Package ohos.agp.window.dialog

Class CommonDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.agp.window.dialog.BaseDialog
      • ohos.agp.window.dialog.CommonDialog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDialog
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ListDialog, ToastDialog

    public class CommonDialog
extends BaseDialog
    Creates a common dialog box.

    You can customize dialogs by means of inheritance and encapsulation. When creating or inheriting dialogs in applications, you need to initialize the dialogs and manage their lifecycle.

    Since:
    1
    See Also:
    BaseDialog

    • Constructor Detail

      • CommonDialog

        public CommonDialog​(Context context)
        A constructor used to create a CommonDialog instance.

        The caller needs to pass in a valid context in order to construct a dialog.

        Parameters:
        context - Indicates the ohos context.

      • onWindowSelectionUpdated

        protected void onWindowSelectionUpdated​(boolean isSelectionUpdated)
        Called when the window selection state changes.
        Parameters:
        isSelectionUpdated - Specifies whether the window is selected. The value true indicates that the window is selected, and false indicates the opposite.
        Since:
        4

      • isMovable

        public boolean isMovable​()
        Checks whether a window is movable.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the window is movable; returns false otherwise.

      • setMovable

        public void setMovable​(boolean movable)
        Sets whether a window is movable.
        Parameters:
        movable - Indicates whether the window is movable. true indicates the window is movable; false indicates the window is not movable.

      • setTitleIcon

        public CommonDialog setTitleIcon​(int resId,
                                 int iconId)
        Sets the icon in the title area.

        Three locations have been reserved for icons in the title area. You can specify where you want the icon to locate by specifying the location ID.

        Parameters:
        resId - Indicates the resource id of the icon to be displayed in the title area.
        iconId - Indicates the location in the title area where you want the icon to be. There are three options: (0) in front of the text; (1) in the middle; and (2) after the text.
        Returns:
        Returns the Dialog object for continuous operations, for example, obj.setTitleText(text).show().
        Since:
        4
        See Also:
        IDialog

      • setTitleText

        public CommonDialog setTitleText​(String text)
        Sets the title text in the title area.

        The title area has reserved space for both the title and subtitle. The subtitle can be set only after the title has been set.

        Parameters:
        text - Indicates the text content of the title to display.
        Returns:
        Returns the Dialog object for continuous operations, for example, obj.setTitleText(text).show().

      • setTitleSubText

        public CommonDialog setTitleSubText​(String text)
        Sets the supplementary text information in the title area.

        The supplementary information complements the title to make the information clearer. It can be left blank.

        Parameters:
        text - Indicates the supplementary text information to display.
        Returns:
        Returns the Dialog object for continuous operations, for example, obj.setTitleText(text).show().

      • setTitleCustomComponent

        public CommonDialog setTitleCustomComponent​(DirectionalLayout component)
        Customizes the title area.
        Parameters:
        component - Indicates the customized DirectionalLayout object that encapsulates the component to be displayed.
        Returns:
        Returns the Dialog object for continuous operations, for example, obj.setTitleText(text).show().
        Since:
        4

      • setContentImage

        public CommonDialog setContentImage​(int resId)
        Sets the icon to be displayed in the content area.

        The content area cannot be empty. It must contain either an icon or text, or both; or use a customized content area.

        Parameters:
        resId - Indicates the resource id of the content to be displayed.
        Returns:
        Returns the Dialog object for continuous operations, for example, obj.setTitleText(text).show().
        Since:
        4

      • setContentText

        public CommonDialog setContentText​(String text)
        Sets the text to be displayed in the content area.

        The content area cannot be empty. It must contain either an icon or text, or both; or use a customized content area.

        Parameters:
        text - Indicates the text information to display in the content area.
        Returns:
        Returns the Dialog object for continuous operations, for example, obj.setTitleText(text).show().

      • setContentCustomComponent

        public CommonDialog setContentCustomComponent​(Component component)
        Customizes the content area.

        The content area cannot be empty. It must contain at least an icon or a text, or use a customized content area.

        Parameters:
        component - Indicates the customized component.
        Returns:
        Returns the Dialog object for continuous operations, for example, obj.setTitleText(text).show().

      • getContentCustomComponent

        public Component getContentCustomComponent​()
        Obtains the content displayed in the content area.

        This method obtains the outermost ComponentContainer, which contains all the displayed content.

        Returns:
        Returns the Component object.

      • getButtonComponent

        public Component getButtonComponent​()
        Obtains the content of button area.

        This method obtains the outermost ComponentContainer, which contains all the displayed button.

        Returns:
        Returns the Component object.

      • getWindow

        public Window getWindow​()
        Obtains the window corresponding to a dialog box.
        Returns:
        Returns the window corresponding to the dialog box.

      • setButton

        public CommonDialog setButton​(int buttonNum,
                              String text,
                              IDialog.ClickedListener listener)
        Sets the buttons in the button area.

        The button area can have a maximum of three buttons by default.

        Parameters:
        buttonNum - Indicates the button location. There are three options: (0) the first button; (1) the button in the middle; and (2) the last button.
        text - Indicates the text displayed on the button.
        listener - Indicates the listener for detecting button pressing and releasing events.
        Returns:
        Returns the Dialog object for continuous operations, for example, obj.setTitleText(text).show().
        See Also:
        IDialog

      • setImageButton

        public CommonDialog setImageButton​(int buttonNum,
                                   int resId,
                                   IDialog.ClickedListener listener)
        Sets the image button for a CommonDialog object.
        Parameters:
        buttonNum - Indicates the position of the image button. The numbers 0, , and specify that the image button is located at the start, in the middle, and at the end respectively.
        resId - Indicates the resource id of the image button resource.
        listener - Indicates the listener for image button pressing and releasing events.
        Returns:
        Returns the CommonDialog object for continuous operations, for example, obj.setTitleText(text).show().
        Since:
        4
        See Also:
        IDialog

      • onDestroy

        protected void onDestroy​()

        Callback interface used when enabling automatic close of a Dialog instance.

        This callback is triggered only when the destroy() method is invoked.

        Overrides:

      • setDestroyedListener

        public void setDestroyedListener​(CommonDialog.DestroyedListener destroyedListener)
        Sets the dialog destruction listener.

        This listener is responsible for necessary handling before dialog destruction.

        Parameters:
        destroyedListener - Indicates the dialog destruction listener.

      • setSwipeToDismiss

        public boolean setSwipeToDismiss​(boolean isEnabled)
        Sets whether to enable the feature of exiting a dialog by swiping right on the screen.
        Parameters:
        isEnabled - Specifies whether to enable the feature of exiting the dialog by swiping on the screen. {code true} indicates enabled; false indicates disabled.
        Returns:
        Returns true if this feature is enabled; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        4

      • deliverKeyboardCase

        public boolean deliverKeyboardCase​(KeyEvent event)
        Delivers a specified keyboard event.
        Parameters:
        event - Indicates the keyboard event to deliver.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the keyboard event is successfully delivered; returns false if the keyboard event fails to be delivered and if both clickKeyDown(ohos.multimodalinput.event.KeyEvent) and clickKeyUp(ohos.multimodalinput.event.KeyEvent) have returned false.
        Since:
        3

      • clickKeyDown

        public boolean clickKeyDown​(KeyEvent event)
        Called when a key on the keyboard is pressed.
        Parameters:
        event - Indicates the key press event.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the key press event is handled; returns false (default) otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • clickKeyUp

        public boolean clickKeyUp​(KeyEvent event)
        Called when a key on the keyboard is released.
        Parameters:
        event - Indicates the key release event.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the key release event is handled; returns false (default) otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • deliverTouchCase

        public boolean deliverTouchCase​(TouchEvent event)
        Delivers a specified touch event.
        Parameters:
        event - Indicates the touch event to deliver.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the touch event is successfully delivered or has been handled via dealTouchEvent(ohos.multimodalinput.event.TouchEvent); returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • dealTouchEvent

        public boolean dealTouchEvent​(TouchEvent event)
        Called when a touch was pressed event.
        Parameters:
        event - Indicates the touch event to deal.
        Returns:
        Returns false for default.
        Since:
        3

      • siteKeyboardCallback

        public void siteKeyboardCallback​(IDialog.KeyboardCallback keyboardCallback)
        Sets a callback for keyboard events.
        Parameters:
        keyboardCallback - Indicates the callback to set. The callback can handle keyboard events before the dialog box does. Keyboard events that have been handled by the callback will be ignored by the dialog box.
        Since:
        3

      • siteRemovable

        public void siteRemovable​(boolean removable)
        Sets whether to remove the dialog box when the user taps the Back key.
        Parameters:
        removable - Specifies whether to remove the dialog box. The value true means to remove the dialog box, and false means the opposite.
        Since:
        3

      • dealBackKeyDown

        public void dealBackKeyDown​()
        Called when the Back key is pressed and released.
        Since:
        3
